pkgmetadata.longdescription: # google-cloud-logging-handlerAllows logging directly into Google Cloud.## MotivationWhen you don't want to log to text files and have a sidecar to ship your logs to Google Cloud, you can use this to send the logs directly to Google Cloud.This is similar to what the [Logback plugin](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-java/tree/master/google-cloud-clients/google-cloud-contrib/google-cloud-logging-logback) is intended for.## UsageYou can use it just like any other logging.Handler.For example```pythonimport loggingfrom logging import configLOG_CONFIG = { 'version': 1, 'formatters': { 'text': { 'format': '%(message)s', } }, 'handlers': { 'stdout': { 'class': 'logging.StreamHandler' }, 'cloud_text': { 'class': 'google_cloud_logging_handler.GoogleCloudHandler', 'log_name': 'server-deep_app', 'formatter': 'text' } }, 'loggers': { 'text': { 'level': 'INFO', 'handlers': ['cloud_text', 'stdout'] } }}config.dictConfig(LOG_CONFIG)text_logger = logging.getLogger('text')text_logger.info("Text 1")```
